name: premnaspirodiene oxygenase
classes: Acting on paired donors, with incorporation or reduction of molecular oxygen;
With NADH or NADPH as one donor, and incorporation of one atom of oxygen into the other donor
reaction: (-)-vetispiradiene + 2 NADPH + 2 H+ + 2 O2 = solavetivone + 2 NADP+ + 3 H2O (overall reaction) [RN:R10073]; (1a) (-)-vetispiradiene + NADPH + H+ + O2 = solavetivol + NADP+ + H2O [RN:R09576]; (1b) solavetivol + NADPH + H+ + O2 = solavetivone + NADP+ + 2 H2O [RN:R09577]
comment: A heme-thiolate protein (P-450). The enzyme from the plant Hyoscymus muticus also hydroxylates valencene at C-2 to give the alpha-hydroxy compound, nootkatol, and this is converted into nootkatone. 5-Epiaristolochene and epieremophilene are hydroxylated at C-2 to give a 2beta-hydroxy derivative which is not further oxidized.

references.title: Functional characterization of premnaspirodiene oxygenase, a cytochrome P450 catalyzing regio- and stereo-specific hydroxylations of diverse sesquiterpene substrates.
